DataElement.preferredName: Radical Prostatectomy Prostate Negative Surgical Margin Benign Glands At Margin NCI Concept Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicates whether benign prostatic glands are present at margin of radical prostatectomy specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radical Prostatectomy Prostate Gland Negative Surgical Margin Benign Prostate Gland
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire prostate. The two types of radical prostatectomy are retropubic prostatectomy and perineal prostatectomy.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:definition pending_Not cancerous; does not invade nearby tissue or spread to other parts of the body.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Radical Prostatectomy Prostate Gland Negative Surgical Margin
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire prostate. The two types of radical prostatectomy are retropubic prostatectomy and perineal prostatectomy.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of all of the prostate as well as some surrounding tissue, including lymph nodes.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
Indicates the absence of tumor cells at the edge of a surgically excised specimen.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not cancerous; does not invade nearby tissue or spread to other parts of the body.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Concepts.definition: For neoplasms, a non-infiltrating and non-metastasizing neoplastic process that is characterized by the absence of morphologic features associated with malignancy (e.g., severe atypia, nuclear pleomorphism, tumor cell necrosis, and abnormal mitoses). For other conditions, a process that is mild in nature and not dangerous to health.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
